latlon2map 0.0.0.9003
  • Reference

    • Removing the boring parts from geocomputation with European data

    Provide a bounding box with a consistent, user given ratio

    ll_bbox.Rd

    This is useful in particular to make geom_sf()-based ggplots with consistent aspect ratio.

    ll_bbox(sf, ratio = "4:3")

    Arguments

    sf

    An sf object.

    ratio

    Defaults to "4:3". A chacters string, in the form of e.g. "4:3" or "16:9" or "1:1" (other values possible)

    Value

    A bounding box vector, same as with sf::st_bbox(), but with the given ratio set and compatible with crs 4326.

    Examples

    if (FALSE) {
# The following two graphs will have same 4:3 aspect ratio
ll_set_folder("~/R/")
library("ggspatial")

sf_location <- ll_get_nuts_it(name = "Palmanova", level = "lau", resolution = "low")

ggplot() +
  annotation_map_tile(type = "osm", zoomin = -1, cachedir = fs::path(ll_set_folder(), "ll_data")) +
  geom_sf(data = sf::st_as_sfc(ll_bbox(sf_location)), fill = NA, color = NA) +
  geom_sf(
    data = sf_location,
    colour = "darkred",
    size = 2,
    fill = NA,
    alpha = 0.8
  )


sf_location <- ll_get_nuts_it(name = "Pinzolo", level = "lau", resolution = "low")

ggplot() +
  annotation_map_tile(type = "osm", zoomin = -1, cachedir = fs::path(ll_set_folder(), "ll_data")) +
  geom_sf(data = sf::st_as_sfc(ll_bbox(sf_location)), fill = NA, color = NA) +
  geom_sf(
    data = sf_location,
    colour = "darkred",
    size = 2,
    fill = NA,
    alpha = 0.8
  )
}
